reviews.review_msg: The course requires a significant amount of reading, and expects active participation. Unlike other courses where you can get away with not doing the reading for a week, this professor will call on you if you're too quiet. They contribute minimally to the class and make students do most of the lecturing. With this prof Chat GTP is your bestfriend.
No Comments
she is a hard and boring prof. I would not recommend people.
I took environmental history with Joseph. He may rub you at first as a tight ass but he's a sweety. I didn't want that class to end, it was fantastic.
Adds his own rating at rate your prof (see first rating)
No Comments
Lectures are fun and full of great information.
Hard marker, boring lectures, if you care about you gpa, find another prof
Yes, by far one of my faves!!! An all around good guy and very approachable. He doesn't pass out As like candy, so expect to do the work to earn your mark. He doesnt seem to care much for slackers.
Great Prof. Enjoys others and thus we enjoy him! Wow that sounded lame; he's a real intelligent and nice man. Have a tea with him sometime and chat about Islam. You'll enjoy.
hes ok, talks too much though.

If all profs were as organized and clear we'd all have a good chance at getting A's. Made sure to cover wymns + aboriginal content thoroughly. Her lectures are pretty much from the book but that helps solidify the concepts and content in your head. Can be funny and easy to talk to. An A from me. Ta was good too her name Rachel Torrie.

Insanely hard marker. You will work SO hard and still never get an A. DO NOT take this prof. I withrdew from her class...TONS of little assignments that she gives you horrible marks on, TONS of reading, just brutal. She wants to hear what SHE thinks. Blah! CAUTION

Moody. You can guess what her nickname is in the history department. Seems to think she is funny, but the way she marks is no laughing matter. Requested explanation of a bare pass on a paper and inexplicably had it raised to where it should have been in the first place. Unless you like being annoyed by a spoiled little frat girl, avoid.
No, Dr. Ferguson will not boost your GPA.  She will, however, strengthen your critical thinking and analytical skills, while taking you to the marrow of the history.
hard marker. good teacher. cute too
No Comments
One of the best I've encountered. Engaging, inspired, caring and helpful. She's a sunny day amidst all the gloom.

Roxanne is the****! ANY class with her is worth taking. She will totally alter the way you read, think, and do history. She is tough but always willing to spend countless hours helping you in person or via email. Super flexible and understanding. Best prof EVER! Why can't more profs be as interesting and engaging?

Entertaining, engaging, challenging. A word to the wise: you CAN get a good mark in his class, but ONLY if you can write. I'm good at essay writing, and thus I got an A-; don't listen to those who say it isn't possible. This guy really makes you think, and that was what *I* thought university was for, don't know about the rest of you guys.
He made a girl in my class almost cry.  She was borderline tears after he basically told her that her answer was completely wrong and made her look like a fool infront of the whole class.

This guy is easily the worst prof I ever had during my 3 years at SFU.  He has a HUGE ego, and his classes are very boring.  His marking criteria is a complete mystery. The workload is also unreasonably large.
intellectual snob.  During the final he laughed and sighed in disgust aloud as he marked exams as they were being handed in.

Excellent prof. I took several European history and WW2 courses from him. Dr. Kitchen captivated me with his vast experience and insightful stories. He made it exciting to come to class. I am dissapointed that he will not be teaching this semester.
Horrible instructor.
Man appears to be senile. Talks about irrelevant things, drifts in and out of material and leaves you hanging. Will often ignore you if he does not like your questions.
A nice guy but really unorganized. He is extremely vague about assignments and just seems to love counterfactuals. Save yourself the headaches and avoid
Dr. Leier is an amazing prof and his lectures are great! The readings he assigned were interesting to read! No tests or quizzes, just 7 essay assignments based on readings.
Dr. Leier made Hist 135 very fun! I recommend this class as it is very interesting.
Great prof.
No Comments
I was in all of her courses.. Awesome prof!!!!

Incapable of delivering a coherent lecture, or responding intelligently to a question - or justifying anything he says.  This doesn't stop him from imposing half-witted "standards" in assignments.  How does SFU hire someone like this for tenure ??!
absolutely wonderful, always willing to answer us, be it email or in person. She seemed like she cared, and tried to help her students pass. She gives amazing feedback too!
